bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 15, 1897

div1.p: Lazear discusses his mother's planned visit to Baltimore.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 15, 1897
div1.p:
I am awfully
glad you are coming
and I hope it will
be soon. I think
you will enjoy it
here, although there
is not such good
music as in New York.
The Orators Society
gave Mendelsohn's St. Paul
last week. The singing
was rather good but
the orchestra poor. The
audience was very peculiar.
reminded one of a
Methodist congregation.

I forgot to thank
you for the wash rags.

I have still a number
of the ones you gave
me last year. You
were always extravagant
in the matter of wash rags.
I find that the lady who is visiting
Cousin Ellen is Cousin Harry's sister
Miss Turnbull.

I have not seen May McCallam
for some time. She promised to
come over but has not and
I have been rushed lately while
at the hospital.
I understand she is doing well.

I shall call in a day or
two. Have you heard from
Mrs. McCallam?
